@EnvAgencyMids aren‚Äôt rubber tracks banned from being buried ? I‚Äôll give you a big clue . Look at this from walleys quarry ! @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #stopthestink https://t.co/Ez0ooSgKCo
@EnvAgencyMids Operations need to be STOPPED until this is a well run compliant site WITHOUT any breaches !!! #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe

Fish kill in the Town Beck this morning, fingerings to 12 inch fish all dead. Clean up your act Driffield, this is a disgrace. @WoldsWeekly @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @YWT_North @EYRiversTrust @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/qFh1q0r5FM

Wild fish and their waters need your help. We have launched a Parliamentary Petition to give @EnvAgency the funds and freedom they need to protect English rivers. Please sign and share our petition to give rivers a fighting chance. #standingupforrivers

tweets.text:
Unfortunately I don't think #WalleysQuarry will be shut down. I suspect pressure from central government is being applied to keep it open. That would explain why @EnvAgencyMids have completely abandoned their role as regulator and taken on the role of facilitator.

#StopTheStink

Thank you for the retweet. My Son said the toxic gases are the worst they‚Äôve ever been tonight. What do we say to our children?üò¢@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson your ideas are not working, this is an #environmentalemergency Send your officers out here now! üôèStinkStopthe https://t.co/d4Ud6lyjM2

tweets.text: @NickMincher @EnvAgencyMids Agreed. I have no idea why a methane flux box survey is going to take another 4 months. Also, if they were serious about getting a solution as quickly as possible, then all waste acceptance should be halted to avoid it being a distraction to the remedial work.

@TeamBen_13 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency I would urge you @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency to look at this issue again TODAY & do something about it. Nose bleeds, headaches, longer term serious health implications from H2S inhalation - this is a huge public health problem & the community are suffering

I have had to phone the @EnvAgency twice today to complain about the stench entering my home in @NewsNBC coming from @RedIndustries2 Walleys Quarry, I can‚Äôt understand why this is allowed to continue??!! Disgusting and disgraceful!!!

#stopthestink good call from Stephen.  The self- regulation policy of checking/accepting waste has been ignored by @RedIndustries2 - profits come first for them! @EnvAgencyMids  spokesperson even hinted at 'findings' from investigating companies who deliver there.

Prevention is better than cure! Stop using us for research & statistics! We have rights, Human Rights! I‚Äôm being gassed out now! @HumanRightsCtte @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @PHE_uk @MindCharity @BorisJohnson @StinkStopthe https://t.co/1a1qpVBp0I

tweets.text:
Words cannot describe how sad we are at this situation. We will be doing our own surveys to find out just how bad the #pollution is and we will be looking for some answers from those who have allowed this to happen!
We must do more to protect our #chalkstreams https://t.co/rGyJxYeV3D

@Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @YISF__INNS @CalderCountry We have Himalayan Balsam growing in empty land next to us. It‚Äôs starting to grow in my garden now üò©. Sadly we‚Äôre not in Calderdale. I hope @bradfordmdc will help us Bash The Balsam here too, especially so as the Balsam growing next to me is on the ‚ÄúMillennium Way‚Äù walk number 4

Different story. Same message. 
@DefraGovUK has ignored the environmental vandalism is Newcastle Staffs this entire time & the @EnvAgency may be moving now but it‚Äôs still far too slow & too little too late for the thousands of ill residents #stopthestink https://t.co/Uiy39VJJcZ
And the @EnvAgency do what exactly? https://t.co/FJmcCwQcYd

@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @YorkDalesRT @TM_WRT @aireriverstrust @BradfordCityAA @YorkshireiCASP @LeedsFAS @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @PeteTurnerEA @LancsUniLEC Huge thank you for sharing your story and getting those trees in the ground! üå≤üå≥üå≤üå≥üå≤

https://t.co/6U8fCT6olk

The dolphin cap has been lifted into place! To minimise risks & increase efficiency it was fabricated on dry ground, then moved & installed in a single lift avoiding the need to work over water. Brilliant work by all involved @BAMNuttall @Red7Marine @MottMacDonald @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/B6jevZsJJb

@EnvAgencyMids How about stopping operations until they are compliant at the very least? Your allowing a company to accept further waste onto a site which has been found in breach of 10 regulations and all they‚Äôve been seen to of done is hire a Relations Manager... How can you justify this?

It‚Äôs frightening , we are living in fear of the gas, fear for our short and long term health and fear for our lives @MattHancock @PHE_WestMids @PHE_EoEngland @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson #stopthestink @DefraGovUK @DefraUKAir @EnvAgency https://t.co/08QFqd7pVy

urls.title: Home - Waters Worth Saving
urls.description: In response to last summer‚Äôs unprecedented demand for water, Water UK and water efficiency experts Waterwise joined forces to raise awareness of the pressures on the UK‚Äôs water resources and help the public to take water-saving measures at home. While it may feel like it rains every day in the UK, we have a finite amount of water to go round. Climate change, population growth and the need to improve our resilience to droughts are all putting pressure on water supplies. The climate emergency is causing an

tweets.text:
Climate change and population growth put pressure on water supply.

We need to use water wisely to make sure we protect this vital resource for the future. 

Find out how you can save water: https://t.co/NxaKnH4gLE

@Waterwise #WaterSavingWeek

urls.title: Dying fish and 'gunge-filled' rivers as pollution soars to dangerous levels | ITV News
urls.description: Our exclusive investigation has found the River Soar near Loughborough had phosphate levels 50 times higher than safe limits.

tweets.text:
EXPOSED: Soaring levels of damaging phosphates in our rivers are revealed in a special @ITVCentral  investigation tonight.

One river in the Midlands was almost 50 times the safe limit.

And we hear evidence of the deadly affect it's having on wildlife.

https://t.co/8A2A1gE2au https://t.co/HkXJpFpqKe
